column4: fools...  It's not hard to get linux support; release the spec and somebody will write a driver.
owner: does it have a network port?
yeah, or in HP's case: sponser a sourceforge project for your stuff...
very very smart move.
I gather that even HP's all-in-one units - printer+scanner - work in Linux now...
use Synaptic and search for mplayer - there's lots of versions...
I just searched Synaptic, there's six or eight mplayer packages
we must have differing sources in the apt conf.
do you have Universe & Multiverse enabled?
yes. I have everything enabled.
& pppoe_dude: search for mplayer here: http://packages.ubuntu.com/
hmm...  weird...  that must be a different repo that it's searching.
check the msg ubotu sent you a while ago, and double-check your sources.list against it
yikes... I was missing a few...   Yet, synaptic whines about those lines...   *shrug*
you're running 5.10 (Breezy), right?
aha!   I was missing one of those that were in the pastebin..
i guess Ubuntu can't provide a link to that repo in the distro?
which repo?
likely Multiverse - that's where all or most of the mplayer stuff is
all of my repos have us.archive.ubuntu...   you think the us.archive makes a difference?
the us archive seems to have more trouble than the rest, for some reason. aside from that, it's identical, AFAIK
